item.title: News24.com | Oath Keepers member to plead guilty to sedition in US Capitol attack
item.description: A member of the far-right Oath Keepers militia group intends to admit to engaging in seditious conspiracy during last year's attack on the US Capitol, according to court papers.

item.title: News24.com | Brazil's Lula says Zelensky shares blame for Ukraine war
item.description: Brazilian presidential front-runner Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin bear equal responsibility for the war in Ukraine.

item.title: News24.com | Biden says talking with G7 leaders this week about further potential sanctions on Russia
item.description: US President Joe Biden said he would speak with other leaders from the Group of Seven advanced economies this week about potential additional sanctions against Russia over its war in Ukraine.

item.title: News24.com | Eight killed in Iraq clashes over farmland
item.description: At least eight people were killed in armed clashes in southern Iraq when arguments over the ownership of agricultural land turned deadly, officials said.

item.title: News24.com | After Roe leak, WHO’s Tedros says safe abortions ‘save lives’
item.description: WHO chief did not directly reference leaked US Supreme Court draft opinion indicating Roe v Wade may soon be overturned.

item.title: News24.com | Vatican preparing for possibility of women Swiss Guards
item.description: The new barracks of the Vatican Swiss guards will be built to accommodate female members if Pope Francis or his successors allow women to join the elite and colourfully dressed force.

item.title: News24.com | WATCH | War in Ukraine: watch all the latest videos as the conflict escalates
News24.com | 'New evidence' in Madeleine McCann case: prosecutor
item.description: German investigators probing the disappearance of Madeleine McCann 15 years ago in Portugal have found new evidence against the chief suspect, a prosecutor told Portuguese television.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Location data from people who visited US abortion clinics is legally on sale for $160, report
item.description: Vice paid a data-brokering company $160 and got phone location data from 600 Planned Parenthoods, some of which provided abortion services.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Oil and natural gas jump in Europe after EU unveils plans to phase out Russian crude within 6 months
item.description: Europe will gradually phase out Russian imports of crude oil and refined products in the coming six months, as it cuts off capital flows to Moscow.

item.title: News24.com | Post Office suspends airmail to China amid Covid-19 wave
item.description: Airmail between South Africa and China has been suspended amid increased Covid-19 cases in the Asian country.

item.title: News24.com | Abortion leak exposes US Supreme Court in disarray
item.description: The leak of a draft US Supreme Court ruling overturning the landmark Roe v. Wade abortion rights decision shows a once-staid body creaking under pressure as its increasingly assertive conservative majority looks to upend the law on a range of major issues.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Hong Kong hitting 'peak exodus'. Experts say UK, Canada, and Australia winners of Hong Kong's loss
item.description: The mass emigration in Hong Kong is due to China's crackdown on Hong Kong and the city-state's strict Covid-19 regulations.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Rumours of Alibaba's Jack Ma possible arrest briefly wiped $26 billion from its market value
item.description: A state-media report said a person surnamed Ma was being probed in Hangzhou, where Alibaba is based. The company's share price promptly slid 9.4%.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | The EU proposes a total ban on Russian oil imports, cutting out crude within 6 months
item.description: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen said the move would be costly to the bloc's economy. "It will not be easy," she said.

item.title: News24.com | Beijing closes dozens of subway stations as Covid controls tighten
item.description: Beijing closed dozens of subway stations on Wednesday, as Covid restrictions slowly constrict movement across the Chinese capital of over 21 million people.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | SpaceX Starlink has 150,000 daily users in Ukraine 5 weeks after being activated
item.description: "This is crucial support for Ukraine's infrastructure and restoring the destroyed territories," vice prime minister Mykhailo Fedorov said.

item.title: News24.com | Pope wants to visit Moscow to meet Putin over Ukraine - paper
item.description: Pope Francis said in an interview published on Tuesday that he asked for a meeting in Moscow with Russian President Vladimir Putin to try to stop the war in Ukraine but had not received a reply.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | The CIA is using Instagram to teach Russians how to share state secrets with them
item.description: The CIA's Instagram post presents Russian language instructions on how to obtain the Tor browser or a VPN network to contact the agency securely.

item.title: News24.com | North Korea fires ballistic missile, Seoul says
item.description: North Korea fired a ballistic missile on Wednesday, South Korea's military said, just a week after leader Kim Jong Un vowed to boost Pyongyang's nuclear arsenal at the "fastest possible speed".
